---

## Visualizations by Category

### ðŸ“ˆ EDA - Exploratory Data Analysis (7 plots)

Generated by: `notebooks/01_data_exploration.ipynb`

| File | Description | Key Insight |
|------|-------------|-------------|
| `target_distribution.png` | Distribution of raw trip durations | Highly right-skewed, mean ~959s |
| `temporal_analysis.png` | Trip patterns by hour and day | Peak activity: 6-8 PM, Friday rush |
| `geospatial_analysis.png` | Pickup/dropoff heatmaps | Manhattan concentrated, airports visible |
| `correlation_matrix.png` | Feature correlation heatmap | High correlation between distance metrics |
| `outlier_boxplots.png` | Box plots for outlier detection | Trips > 10,000s identified as outliers |
| `missing_values_analysis.png` | Missing data percentage by feature | Most features complete, some < 1% missing |

|------|-------------|-------------|
| `target_transformation.png` | Before/after log transformation | Log transform normalizes distribution |

| `model_comparison.png` | Performance across 5 models | XGBoost best: RÂ²=0.8234 |

### ðŸ” Model Interpretability - SHAP Analysis (4 plots)

Generated by: `notebooks/04_model_interpretation.ipynb`

| File | Description | Key Insight |
|------|-------------|-------------|
| `shap_importance.png` | Global feature importance (SHAP) | Distance features account for >85% |
| `shap_summary.png` | Beeswarm plot showing feature effects | High distance â†’ high prediction |
| `shap_dependence.png` | Detailed dependence plot for top feature | Non-linear relationship visible |
| `shap_local_0.png` | Waterfall plot for single prediction | Example showing feature contributions |

---

## How to Regenerate

To regenerate all visualizations, execute notebooks in order:

```bash
# Start Jupyter
jupyter notebook notebooks/

# Run in sequence:
# 1. 01_data_exploration.ipynb     â†’ Generates 7 EDA plots
# 2. 02_feature_engineering.ipynb  â†’ Generates 1 transformation plot
# 3. 03_modeling.ipynb              â†’ Generates 2 modeling plots
# 4. 04_model_interpretation.ipynb â†’ Generates 4 SHAP plots
```

**Note:** All visualizations are automatically saved at 150 DPI with tight bounding boxes for report quality.

---

## Technical Details

### Image Specifications

- **Format:** PNG
- **DPI:** 150 (high resolution for reports)
- **Size:** Varies (typically 1200-1800px width)
- **Backend:** matplotlib with seaborn styling

### Color Palettes

- **EDA plots:** Seaborn default palette
- **SHAP plots:** Red-blue diverging (red = high value, blue = low value)
- **Feature importance:** Viridis gradient

---

## Usage in Reports

All plots are referenced in:
- **Technical Report:** `docs/technical_report.md`
- **Academic Requirements:** Section 3.7 (Visualizations)
- **Streamlit App:** Some plots displayed in sidebar

For detailed interpretation of each plot, refer to the corresponding notebook and technical report sections.
